page.title: 19TYWARDREATH PRIORY
page.content: The{Priory at Tywardreath}was founded before 1169. Benedictine monks from Normandy came by boat as the Priory was on the water's edge. The Priory was in the lane near today's church but no one knows exactly where. It was closed in 1536. {Tywardreath means "House on the Sand"} because it used to be coastal. Most of Par was covered by water when the tide came in. The monks built the first causeway from what is now St.Andrew's Bridge to St. Blazey. 3 men were drowned on the causeway in the 1300's, one was a monk, because they did not check the tide. A ferry took people from the bottom of Vicarage Rd. to the bottom of The Mount. The Priory made Tywardreath very important in the area and the village grew round the Priory.
